pullRequest.title: Inclusive terms for infra scripts
pullRequest.bodyText:
slave -> node
whitelist -> allowlist
blacklist -> blocklist
Jenkins master -> Jenkins Manager node

beforeCommit.message:
Replace blacklist with blocklist

[skip ci]
Issue #10071

Signed-off-by: Adam Brousseau <adam.brousseau88@gmail.com>

afterCommit.message:
Replace blacklist with blocklist

[skip ci]
Issue #10071

Signed-off-by: Adam Brousseau <adam.brousseau88@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText: Perhaps .copyright_ignore is a more consistent name (think .gitignore)?
Elsewhere are references to 'the Jenkins Manager node': we should be consistent.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -21,7 +21,7 @@ SPDX-License-Identifier: EPL-2.0 OR Apache-2.0 OR GPL-2.0 WITH Classpath-excepti
 -->
 # About
 Artifactory is a binary repository manager.
-Our server is being used to store the Jenkins artifacts between builds to save space on the Jenkins master. The artifacts will be kept for a period after the job in case someone needs to debug the build.
+Our server is being used to store the Jenkins artifacts between builds to save space on the Jenkins manager. The artifacts will be kept for a period after the job in case someone needs to debug the build.

nodes.bodyText: I think it should be two words: 'allow list'.
#10071 anticipated using 'worker': why the departure from that plan?
Again, I think .copyright_ignore is a more consistent file name (notice the echo command).
nit: It's not really 'syntax', but the function name is defined by that plugin.
'block_list' would be more consistent relative to 'admin_list'.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -135,7 +135,7 @@ PullRequest-OpenJ9:
             trigger_phrase: .*\bjenkins\s+(compile|test)\b.*
             cron: "H/5 * * * *"
             admin_list: "OpenJ9"
-            blacklist: "kenrai123"
+            blocklist: "kenrai123"

afterCommit.message:
Replace terms in infrastructure script with more inclusive ones

Replace slave with node in infra scripts
Replace whitelist with allowlist in various infra scripts
Replace blacklist with blocklist
Replace Jenkins Master with Jenkins Manager

Issue #10071
[skip ci]

Signed-off-by: Adam Brousseau <adam.brousseau88@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText: I couldn't find doc why we didn't call it .copyrightignore so I'm fine to change it to that.
The Jenkins project uses node to refer to machines connected to Jenkins that do work. I think we should use node to be consistent with them.
I think the file should be named .copyrightignore (lower-case) for consistency with other 'ignore' files and it should continue to be self-referential (the line should say .copyrightignore).
I suggest this would be easier to follow if the variable were IGNORE_LIST to be consistent with the name of the file it is from (which should be .copyrightignore).
